title: Significant Reduction in Nitrous Oxide Emissions
description: North Korea achieved a remarkable 67.13% reduction in nitrous oxide emissions from 1990 levels by 2023, showcasing a significant environmental improvement.

title: High Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, 86.98% of women aged 15-64 in North Korea participated in the labor force, indicating strong female workforce involvement.

title: High Overall Labor Force Participation
description: By 2024, North Korea had an impressive total labor force participation rate of 88.996% for individuals aged 15-64.

title: Low Immunization Rates for Children
description: In 2023, only 16% of one-year-old children in North Korea received the HepB3 vaccine, highlighting a significant public health challenge.

title: Limited Access to Sanitation in Rural Areas
description: As of 2022, only 1.23% of the rural population in North Korea had access to safely managed sanitation services, indicating a critical infrastructure gap.

title: Minimal Merchandise Imports from High-Income Economies
description: In 2023, only 0.18% of North Korea's merchandise imports came from high-income economies, reflecting limited trade with wealthier nations.

title: High Dependence on Regional Imports
description: 97.10% of North Korea's merchandise imports in 2023 were sourced from low- and middle-income economies within East Asia & Pacific, indicating regional trade reliance.

title: Low Statistical Performance in Data Use
description: North Korea scored only 10 out of 100 in the Statistical Performance Indicators for data use in 2023, suggesting challenges in data-driven decision-making.

title: Poor Regulatory Quality
description: In 2023, North Korea's regulatory quality was estimated at -2.39, indicating significant challenges in governance and regulatory frameworks.

title: Limited Voice and Accountability
description: With an estimate of -1.98 in 2023, North Korea faces challenges in voice and accountability, reflecting restricted civic freedoms.
